intro: Asterohyptis mocinoana, commonly known as the Mocino's asterohyptis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Asterohyptis mocinoana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along streambanks.
